channel.title: Youdied method: glitched

item.title: Youdied method: glitched
item.dc:creator: @For For ( ; ; )
item.description:
@For wrote:

It tries to remove equipment …

for(int r=0; r<playerEquipment.length; r++) { try { int item = playerEquipment[r]; if((item > 0) && (item < 20000)) { remove(item, r); } } catch(Exception e) { sM("ERROR: Removing Equipment"); } }

Then deletes your items and drops them

for(int rr=0; rr<playerItems.length; rr++) { try { if(playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 20000) { //createItem(currentX,currentY,playerItems[rr]-1); ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[rr], KillerId, false); //createGroundItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[i]); deleteItem(playerItems[rr]-1, getItemSlot(playerItems[rr]-1), playerItemsN[rr]); } } catch(Exception e) { } }

Then does it again incase your inven was full.

You could eliminate having to do that second loop by making it delete the equipment and drop it in the same part instead of just removing.

Read full topic

item.title: Youdied method: glitched
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

Maybe when your inventory is full and it tries to take off your equipment it doesn’t work? Or am I wrong

Read full topic

item.title: Youdied method: glitched
item.dc:creator: @For For ( ; ; )
item.description:
@For wrote:

Nub it’s supposed to delete the item so it doesn’t drop to the ground … since he has this later in the method, and it’s obvious just by looking at it, you could tell that.

if(keepItem != 0) addItem(keepItem, keepItemAmount);

I do suggest remaking the youdied method because it can be made more efficient instead of needing to loop 2 times. P.S. rename it youDied proper java conventions please and thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: Youdied method: glitched
item.dc:creator: @xx_nub_xx xx nub xx
item.description:
@xx_nub_xx wrote:

[quote=“delta, post:1, topic:175112”]Ok when you die and have a full inventory and protect item on, you will lose everything? What is wrong? Here is my youdied method

public void youdied() { for(int r=0; r<playerEquipment.length; r++) { try { int item = playerEquipment[r]; if((item > 0) && (item < 20000)) { remove(item, r); } } catch(Exception e) { sM("ERROR: Removing Equipment"); } } if (ProtItem && freeSlots() > 0) { keepItem1(); deleteItem(keepItem, getItemSlot(keepItem), keepItemAmount); } for(int rr=0; rr<playerItems.length; rr++) { try { if(playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 20000) { //createItem(currentX,currentY,playerItems[rr]-1); ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[rr], KillerId, false); //createGroundItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[i]); deleteItem(playerItems[rr]-1, getItemSlot(playerItems[rr]-1), playerItemsN[rr]); } } catch(Exception e) { } } removeAllItems(); for(int r=0; r<playerEquipment.length; r++) { try { int item = playerEquipment[r]; if((item > 0) && (item < 20000)) { remove(item, r); } } catch(Exception e) { sM("ERROR: Removing Equipment"); } } for(int rr=0; rr<playerItems.length; rr++) { try { if(playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 20000) { //createItem(currentX,currentY,playerItems[rr]-1); ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[rr], KillerId, false); //createGroundItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[i]); deleteItem(playerItems[rr]-1, getItemSlot(playerItems[rr]-1), playerItemsN[rr]); } } catch(Exception e) { } } removeAllItems(); hitDiff = 0; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; if (ProtItem && freeSlots() > 0) { if(keepItem != 0) addItem(keepItem, keepItemAmount); } resetKeepItem(); }[/quote]

i would recommend just rebuilding the void from scratch, because it helps you to understand how it works, and then you can edit it later.

well for one thing this looks like it deletes the item that was selected to be kept

			deleteItem(keepItem, getItemSlot(keepItem), keepItemAmount);

and you might have to add

if(item != keepItem) {

after the

 		if(playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 20000) {

because it doesnt look like it checks if it is a keepItem or not it just deletes everything

sorry if that didn’t help ive never worked with that void before

PS about the full inventory part… maybe if you remove

&& freeSlots() > 0

from the

		if (ProtItem && freeSlots() > 0) {
                	keepItem1();
			deleteItem(keepItem, getItemSlot(keepItem), keepItemAmount);
		}

so that it will select a keepItem even with a full inventory (you can try it at least)

Read full topic

item.title: Youdied method: glitched
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

Ok when you die and have a full inventory and protect item on, you will lose everything? What is wrong? Here is my youdied method

public void youdied() { for(int r=0; r<playerEquipment.length; r++) { try { int item = playerEquipment[r]; if((item > 0) && (item < 20000)) { remove(item, r); } } catch(Exception e) { sM("ERROR: Removing Equipment"); } } if (ProtItem && freeSlots() > 0) { keepItem1(); deleteItem(keepItem, getItemSlot(keepItem), keepItemAmount); } for(int rr=0; rr<playerItems.length; rr++) { try { if(playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 20000) { //createItem(currentX,currentY,playerItems[rr]-1); ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[rr], KillerId, false); //createGroundItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[i]); deleteItem(playerItems[rr]-1, getItemSlot(playerItems[rr]-1), playerItemsN[rr]); } } catch(Exception e) { } } removeAllItems(); for(int r=0; r<playerEquipment.length; r++) { try { int item = playerEquipment[r]; if((item > 0) && (item < 20000)) { remove(item, r); } } catch(Exception e) { sM("ERROR: Removing Equipment"); } } for(int rr=0; rr<playerItems.length; rr++) { try { if(playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 20000) { //createItem(currentX,currentY,playerItems[rr]-1); ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[rr], KillerId, false); //createGroundItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[i]); deleteItem(playerItems[rr]-1, getItemSlot(playerItems[rr]-1), playerItemsN[rr]); } } catch(Exception e) { } } removeAllItems(); hitDiff = 0; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; if (ProtItem && freeSlots() > 0) { if(keepItem != 0) addItem(keepItem, keepItemAmount); } resetKeepItem(); }

Read full topic
